channel.title: Drinks on The Drowning Sparrow
channel.description: Recent content in Drinks on The Drowning Sparrow

item.title: Flotsam and Jetsam
item.description: Flotsam and Jetsam Sometimes you need volume of liquid to stay hydrated. Maybe from a workout, or may a discussion you just had that sucked all the brain cell right out of your head. Diet Coke / can Dr. Pepper Zero / can Diet Sunkist / glass Water / bottle Green Tea / glass Hot Tea / cup We may also have ginger beer or ginger ale based on what has been happening at The Sparrow and what donations have been brought in.

item.title: La Mandibula de Tejas
item.description: Giving the story of the “The Jaw” a more south-by-southwest flavor.

item.title: Northbound Flyover Mojito
item.description: A light, mid-western perspective on the Caribbean classic using local berries and a local weed.

item.title: Old-World Sparrow
item.description: Old-Fashioneds are only old fashioned when someone else does them.

item.title: The Aviary
item.description: A light, refreshing, but deceptively potent take on the classic Avation cocktail.

item.title: The Jaw
item.description: Kate shares a personal story as to why this drink is important to her.

item.title: The Reboot
item.description: Erase your old timeline with a new one. Except, this time you’re Chris Pine.

item.title: July House Beer
item.description: Monthly House Beer We’re not fancy. We don’t brew our own beer so we have to highlight what we have. Usually, this distinction falls on whatever we have the most of at the moment in an effort to get rid of it. This month it’s: Bud Light - by bottle or can, cold Next month? Could be the same or it could be a mix of other beers left over from whatever members' “meeting” we had.
